title: Unpacking Inno Setup installers with InnoExtractor?
content:
I want to know how to use the application InnoExtractor to unpack/extract the files of Inno Setup installers. Some good tutorial/video to learn?

I get this application from here .

comments.text: I don't think you need a tutorial for just using InnoExtractor. If you want to look into how it works, you should either search if the source code is available, or reverse engineer it.
You could use Innounp .
You can download InnoSetup's source code on GitHub. This will help you understand how the files are packed: github.com/jrsoftware/issrc
@Ange: InnoExtractor is a front-end GUI for Innounp.

Thanks for all replies. Look... I have an installer based on Inno Setup and I need to learn how to use InnoExtractor to unpack/extract files of the installer and later repack them again with my own files. Is this possible?
